name: RetrieveWebinarParticipants
description:
Retrieve participants of a past Zoom webinar.

Use this tool to get a list of participants who attended a past webinar on Zoom. Ensure the webinar has concluded and allow time for participant data to process, especially for large events. Suitable for checking attendance records.

parameters.name: webinar_id
parameters.description: The ID or UUID of the webinar. If it starts with '/' or contains '//' ensure it is double encoded.

value_schema.description:
The webinar's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a webinar ID, the API returns a response for the latest webinar instance. 
* If you provide a webinar UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** [double encode](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/using-zoom-apis/#meeting-id-and-uuid) the webinar UUID before making an API request.

parameters.name: number_of_records_per_call
parameters.description: Specify the number of participant records to retrieve in a single API call. This helps control the size of each data page.

value_schema.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: pagination_token_for_participants
parameters.description: Token to fetch the next page of webinar participants. Expires in 15 minutes.

value_schema.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Zoom Meetings API.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

value_schema.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

value_schema.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: webinarId
parameters.description:
The webinar's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a webinar ID, the API returns a response for the latest webinar instance. 
* If you provide a webinar UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** [double encode](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/using-zoom-apis/#meeting-id-and-uuid) the webinar UUID before making an API request.

value_schema.description:
The webinar's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a webinar ID, the API returns a response for the latest webinar instance. 
* If you provide a webinar UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** [double encode](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/using-zoom-apis/#meeting-id-and-uuid) the webinar UUID before making an API request.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
